    • How to handle the API key in public and private codes.

Retrieve data for taxomomic groups.

Source: vignettes/data_for_taxa_groups.Rmd
data_for_taxa_groups.Rmd
library(fwtraits)

Step 1: Securing and loading the API key.

Please follow the secure_the_api_key steps and secure the API in the R environment before retrieving the species traits form the database. To check on the available traits in the database, you can check with the fw_dbguide() or browse the database directly in database traits.

Step2: Fetching groups data and visualisation

  • To ensure the exact trait spellings are used, the user is strongly advised to run fw_dbguide() function and filter out the organism groups. The trait names can be copied and pasted in the ecoparams parameter of the fw_fetchdata() function.

  • Multiple species can be set in a list or dataframe.

  • Wide data formats can be displayed, but the longer version is the output by default.

  • Ensure the right species names are indicated to avoid detailed checks that delays data search and might lead to erroneous trait extraction or errors. Checks are conducted on the species names to ensure they are harmonized to trait searches.

1. Fishes

1.1: Single species


migration <- fw_fetchdata(data = "Abramis brama",
                          organismgroup = 'fi',
                          ecoparams = 'migration',
                          cachefolder = 'cache')
#>  ======================================================================== 
#>  Congratulations!!! Ready to interact with Freshwaterecology.info database 
#>  =========================================================================

head(migration)
#>   organismgroup       species parameter description value parametervalue
#> 1          Fish Abramis brama migration   migration   pot  potamodromous

#species data archived in fwtraits

data("speciesdata") 

traitsout <- fw_fetchdata(data = speciesdata, 
                           organismgroup = 'fi',
                           spcol = 'scientificName', 
                           ecoparams = c('migration', 'threat austria',
                                         'oxygen tolerence', 'migration fibs'),
                           cachefolder  = 'cache')
head(traitsout)
#>   organismgroup                species      parameter description value
#> 1          Fish      Anguilla anguilla migration fibs        long     1
#> 2          Fish            Salmo salar migration fibs        long     1
#> 3          Fish          Barbus barbus migration fibs      medium     1
#> 4          Fish       Lampetra planeri migration fibs      medium     1
#> 5          Fish Gasterosteus aculeatus migration fibs      medium     1
#> 6          Fish      Alburnus alburnus migration fibs       short     1
#>   parametervalue
#> 1           long
#> 2           long
#> 3         medium
#> 4         medium
#> 5         medium
#> 6          short

1.3 Visualizing fish traits

 
fw_visualize(output = traitsout)

2. Macroinvertebrates

2.1: Single species


mmdata_traits <- fw_fetchdata(data =  "Margaritifera margaritifera",
                                        organismgroup = 'mi',
                                        ecoparams = c('stream zonation preference'),
                                        inform = TRUE,
                                        cachefolder = 'cache')
#> Macroinvertebrates for parameter -1- data is downloading. Be patient..

2.2: More than one species in a vector/list


speciesvec <- c("Margaritifera margaritifera",
                 "Pseudunio auricularius",
                 "Musculium lacustre",
                 "Musculium transversum",
                 "Parastenocaris germanica")

multspp <- fw_fetchdata(data =  speciesvec,
                        organismgroup = 'mi',
                        ecoparams = c('stream zonation preference'),
                        inform = TRUE,
                        cachefolder = 'cache')
#> Macroinvertebrates data was downloaded already
head(multspp)
#>        organismgroup                     species                  parameter
#> 1 Macroinvertebrates          Musculium lacustre stream zonation preference
#> 2 Macroinvertebrates       Musculium transversum stream zonation preference
#> 3 Macroinvertebrates Margaritifera margaritifera stream zonation preference
#> 4 Macroinvertebrates Margaritifera margaritifera stream zonation preference
#> 5 Macroinvertebrates          Musculium lacustre stream zonation preference
#> 6 Macroinvertebrates          Musculium lacustre stream zonation preference
#>   description value parametervalue
#> 1         epo     2     epipotamal
#> 2         epo     3     epipotamal
#> 3         erh     2    epirhithral
#> 4         hrh     3   hyporhithral
#> 5         hyc     1     hypocrenal
#> 6         lit     5       littoral

2.3: More than one species in a dataframe


macrodf <- data.frame(organismgroup = rep('mi', 13),
                      species = c("Margaritifera margaritifera",
                                  "Pseudunio auricularius",
                                  "Musculium lacustre",
                                  "Musculium transversum",
                                  "Corbicula fluminea",
                                  "Congeria leucophaeata",
                                  "Dreissena polymorpha",
                                  "Dreissena rostriformis bugensis",
                                  "Parastenocaris germaica",
                                  "Branchiobdella balcanica",
                                  "Branchiobdella hexadonta",
                                  "Branchiobdella parasita",
                                  "Branchiobdella pentadonta"))

multspp_df <- fw_fetchdata(data =  macrodf,
                           organismgroup = 'mi',
                           spcol = 'species',
                           ecoparams = c("stream zonation preference", "feeding type"),
                           cachefolder = 'cache')
head(multspp_df)
#>        organismgroup                         species    parameter description
#> 1 Macroinvertebrates            Dreissena polymorpha feeding type         aff
#> 2 Macroinvertebrates     Margaritifera margaritifera feeding type         aff
#> 3 Macroinvertebrates              Musculium lacustre feeding type         aff
#> 4 Macroinvertebrates Dreissena rostriformis bugensis feeding type         aff
#> 5 Macroinvertebrates              Corbicula fluminea feeding type         aff
#> 6 Macroinvertebrates           Congeria leucophaeata feeding type         aff
#>   value        parametervalue
#> 1    10 active filter feeders
#> 2    10 active filter feeders
#> 3    10 active filter feeders
#> 4    10 active filter feeders
#> 5    10 active filter feeders
#> 6    10 active filter feeders

2.4: Data visualization for macroinvertebrates

If the species considered are more than 1, then visualization can be to determine the frequency of each trait. This is an optional function for post data searches.


fw_visualize(output = multspp)


fw_visualize(output = multspp_df)

3. Macrophytes 


mpp <- fw_fetchdata(data = c("Amblystegium fluviatile",
                               "Amblystegium humile",
                               "Amblystegium riparium",
                               "Amblystegium serpens",
                               "Amblystegium tenax",
                               "Amblystegium varium"),
                          organismgroup = 'mp',
                          ecoparams = c('zone - systema'),
                          cachefolder = 'cache')

4. Phytobenthos 


pbdata <- fw_fetchdata(data = c("Gongrosira debaryana",
                             "Gongrosira fluminensis",
                             "Hydrodictyon reticulatum",
                             "Sphaerobotrys fluviatilis",
                             "Stigeoclonium farctum",
                             "Stigeoclonium tenue",
                             "Tetraspora gelatinosa",
                             "Thorea hispida"),
                      organismgroup = 'pb',
                      ecoparams = c('substrate preference'),
                      cachefolder = 'cache', na.rm = FALSE)
head(pbdata)
#>   organismgroup                   species            parameter
#> 1   Phytobentho      Gongrosira debaryana substrate preference
#> 2   Phytobentho      Gongrosira debaryana substrate preference
#> 3   Phytobentho    Gongrosira fluminensis substrate preference
#> 4   Phytobentho Sphaerobotrys fluviatilis substrate preference
#> 5   Phytobentho     Stigeoclonium farctum substrate preference
#> 6   Phytobentho       Stigeoclonium tenue substrate preference
#>            description  value parametervalue
#> 1 substrate preference (EPPH)           <NA>
#> 2 substrate preference   EPLI      epilithic
#> 3 substrate preference   EPLI      epilithic
#> 4 substrate preference   EPLI      epilithic
#> 5 substrate preference   EPLI      epilithic
#> 6 substrate preference   EPLI      epilithic

mipbdata <- fw_fetchdata(data = list(mi=c("Congeria kusceri",
                            "Congeria leucophaeata",
                            "Dreissena polymorpha",
                            "Dreissena rostriformis bugensis"),
                            pb= c("Gongrosira debaryana",
                                   "Gongrosira fluminensis",
                                   "Hydrodictyon reticulatum",
                                   "Sphaerobotrys fluviatilis",
                                   "Stigeoclonium farctum",
                                   "Stigeoclonium tenue",
                                   "Tetraspora gelatinosa",
                                   "Thorea hispida")),
                   organismgroup = c('mi','pb'),
                   ecoparams = list(mi = c('stream zonation preference'),
                                    pb = c('substrate preference')),
                   cachefolder = 'cache')

head(mipbdata)
#>        organismgroup                         species                  parameter
#> 1 Macroinvertebrates            Dreissena polymorpha stream zonation preference
#> 2 Macroinvertebrates Dreissena rostriformis bugensis stream zonation preference
#> 3 Macroinvertebrates           Congeria leucophaeata stream zonation preference
#> 4 Macroinvertebrates            Dreissena polymorpha stream zonation preference
#> 5 Macroinvertebrates Dreissena rostriformis bugensis stream zonation preference
#> 6 Macroinvertebrates Dreissena rostriformis bugensis stream zonation preference
#>   description value parametervalue
#> 1         epo     2     epipotamal
#> 2         epo     2     epipotamal
#> 3         hpo     6    hypopotamal
#> 4         lit     4       littoral
#> 5         lit     4       littoral
#> 6         mpo     4    metapotamal

5. Phytoplankton 


ppdata <- fw_fetchdata(data = c("Anathece clathrata",
                             "Anathece minutissima",
                             "Anthophysa vegetans",
                             "Apocalathium aciculiferum",
                             "Adlafia minuscula var. muralis"),
                    organismgroup = 'pp',
                    ecoparams = c('stenoecy factor', 'life form'),
                    cachefolder = 'cache')

head(ppdata)
#>   organismgroup                 species       parameter    description value
#> 1 Phytoplankton   Aphanothece clathrata       life form      life form     P
#> 2 Phytoplankton   Aphanothece clathrata       life form      life form     P
#> 3 Phytoplankton Aphanothece minutissima       life form      life form     P
#> 4 Phytoplankton Aphanothece minutissima       life form      life form     P
#> 5 Phytoplankton Aphanothece minutissima stenoecy factor     river - CH     1
#> 6 Phytoplankton Aphanothece minutissima stenoecy factor river - Danube     1
#>            parametervalue
#> 1                planktic
#> 2                planktic
#> 3                planktic
#> 4                planktic
#> 5 Central Highland rivers
#> 6     Danube Basin rivers

step3. References

  • Schmidt-Kloiber, A., & Hering, D. (2015). www.freshwaterecology.info - An online tool that unifies, standardises and codifies more than 20,000 European freshwater organisms and their ecological preferences. Ecological Indicators, 53, 271-282. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecolind.2015.02.007
